intro: Titanotrichum oldhamii, commonly known as the Oldham's spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive cyathium inflorescences. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems, which are typical of the genus Titanotrichum. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
